intro: Corylus brevirostris, commonly known as the short-beaked hazelnut, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and catkins. The plant produces edible nuts enclosed in a cupule, which are a food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in woodland habitats. Corylus brevirostris plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity and soil stabilization.
